attributes.action: Apologise to the people of the UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Today, on the 24th February 2010, The British Prime Minister apologised on behalf of the nation for Britain’s role in sending thousands of children overseas until the late 1960s. Although not personally involved he saw fit to carry out this function.  I Now petition the Prime Minister to apologise to THIS nation for his policy of stage managing the influx of millions of immigrants into the UK.  We, the people are owed an apology for that more than those to whom you apologised today.

reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
